title: Montreal gold discovery prompts questions about Pearson heist - Video - CityNews Montreal
text: “I am extremely happy the system is in fact available right now,” says medical toxicologist Dr. Martin Laliberte, now that all Quebec emergency rooms are equipped with kits to detect traces of date-rape drugs in urine. Alyssia Rubertucci reports. 1h ago “I really hope that what that means is that they finally see our perspective,” says Marion Miller, a teacher part of the FAE, as the union along with the Common Front struck full tentative deals with the Quebec government. Rubertucci reports. 1h ago “I will miss being 40,000 feet over the Atlantic, talking to Marie-Pierre,” says newly retired Captain Jean Castonguay. After 37 years, he piloted his final Air Canada flight with his daughter as his First Officer. Anastasia Dextrene reports. 20h ago “I am extremely happy the system is in fact available right now,” says medical toxicologist Dr. Martin Laliberte, now that all Quebec emergency rooms are equipped with kits to detect traces of date-rape drugs in urine. Alyssia Rubertucci reports. 1h ago “I really hope that what that means is that they finally see our perspective,” says Marion Miller, a teacher part of the FAE, as the union along with the Common Front struck full tentative deals with the Quebec government.
